xyz.fsgik.common.bean.handlers

Class AbstractBeanResolveHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyz.fsgik.common.bean.handlers.AbstractBeanResolveHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FsBeanResolver.Handler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JavaBeanResolveHandler, RecordBeanResolveHandler

    public abstract class AbstractBeanResolveHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements FsBeanResolver.Handler
    Base abstract bean resolve handler, provides a skeletal implementation of the FsBeanResolver.Handler to minimize the effort required to implement the interface backed by "method-based" getters/setters.

    This method uses Class.getMethods() to find out all methods, then put each of them into isGetter(Method) and isSetter(Method) method to determine whether it is a getter/setting. If it is, it will be wrapped to a property.

    buildMethodInvoker(Method) can be overridden to build custom method invoker. Default is FsInvoker.reflectMethod(Method).

    • Method Detail

      • resolve

        @Nullable
public void resolve(FsBeanResolver.ResolveContext context)
        Description copied from interface: FsBeanResolver.Handler
        Resolves bean from given resolving context, of which properties map (from FsBeanResolver.ResolveContext.beanProperties()) is readable and writeable. Each handler can operate the properties map -- add new property or remove property which is resolved by previous handler.

        In general, all handlers in the resolver (FsBeanResolver.getHandlers()) will be invoked this method sequentially. If a handler want to prevent next resolving, call FsBeanResolver.ResolveContext.breakResolving() to tell the resolver to break and finish resolving after current resolution.

        Specified by:
        resolve in interface FsBeanResolver.Handler
        Parameters:
        context - given resolving context
        See Also:
        FsBeanResolver
